pr_title: Add a SuperDataset tag for custom super size dataset shards config in es storage

timeline.message: add SuperDataset tag for add super size dataset shards config in es

timeline.bodyText: This should be kept in 2, endpoint metrics could be a big size too.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: Metrics may the data reach 30G per day, if it is below this, it can be adjusted to 1 for mostly users
replies.author: EvanLjp

replies.bodyText: I am not following your meaning. Could you be more clear?
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
the following image is a index in our preonline  environmen(the number of endpoint is about 203)t:

in 0516, there are have 124060 docs, and the size of it is about 13.6M
From the data above, it seems that 30G can already store a lot of metrics data
Unless it is a very large system, I don't think it will exceed 30G
In es 6 ,the default shards number is 5
in es 7,the default shards number is 1 ,The reason is that the shards setting is unreasonable
So I think  It's enough to set one shards for skywalking metrics data
replies.author: EvanLjp

replies.bodyText: OK, make sense. Please follow other comments to continue.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: Is there a checkstyle file for skywalking, I want to set it in idea
replies.author: EvanLjp

replies.bodyText: Yes, of course. It is inside the root folder.
replies.author: wu-sheng

timeline.message: explain the meaning of indexShardsNumber and superDatasetIndexShardsFactor

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                superDatasetIndexShardsFactor: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_SUPER_DATASET_INDEX_SHARDS_FACTOR:5} # If open segment record store, the segment shards number = indexShardsNumber * superDatasetIndexShardsFactor. And also in effect at Zipkin or Jaeger span data store.
          
          
            
                superDatasetIndexShardsFactor: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_SUPER_DATASET_INDEX_SHARDS_FACTOR:5} # Super data set has been defined in the codes, such as trace segments. This factor provides more shards for the super data set, shards number = indexShardsNumber * superDatasetIndexShardsFactor. Also, this factor effects Zipkin and Jaeger traces.
timeline.author: wu-sheng
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -98,7 +98,8 @@ storage:
     password: ${SW_ES_PASSWORD:""}
     secretsManagementFile: ${SW_ES_SECRETS_MANAGEMENT_FILE:""} # Secrets management file in the properties format includes the username, password, which are managed by 3rd party tool.
     dayStep: ${SW_STORAGE_DAY_STEP:1} # Represent the number of days in the one minute/hour/day index.
-    indexShardsNumber: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_INDEX_SHARDS_NUMBER:2}
+    indexShardsNumber: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_INDEX_SHARDS_NUMBER:1} # The index shards number is for store metrics data rather than basic segment record
+    superDatasetIndexShardsFactor: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_SUPER_DATASET_INDEX_SHARDS_FACTOR:5} # If open segment record store, the segment shards number = indexShardsNumber * superDatasetIndexShardsFactor. And also in effect at Zipkin or Jaeger span data store.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                superDatasetIndexShardsFactor: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_SUPER_DATASET_INDEX_SHARDS_FACTOR:5} # If open segment record store, the segment shards number = indexShardsNumber * superDatasetIndexShardsFactor. And also in effect at Zipkin or Jaeger span data store.
          
          
            
                superDatasetIndexShardsFactor: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_SUPER_DATASET_INDEX_SHARDS_FACTOR:5} # Super data set has been defined in the codes, such as trace segments. This factor provides more shards for the super data set, shards number = indexShardsNumber * superDatasetIndexShardsFactor. Also, this factor effects Zipkin and Jaeger traces.
